title: 114_hr2238
content: The "Craft Beverage Bond Simplification Act of 2015" removes bond requirements and extends filing periods for certain taxpayers with limited excise tax liability. The "Craft Beverage Bond Simplification Act of 2015" amends filing requirements for taxpayers with limited excise tax liability under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Craft Beverage Bond Simplification Act of 2015" amends tax payment deadlines for taxpayers with limited excise tax liability under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The deadline for tax payment on withdrawals, removals, and entries is the 14th day after the calendar year. The "Craft Beverage Bond Simplification Act of 2015" amends tax payment deadlines for taxpayers with limited excise tax liability under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The $1,000 limit does not apply to taxpayers once their aggregate tax due exceeds that amount in a calendar year. Any unpaid tax is due on the 14th day after the last day of the quarter in which the limit is exceeded. Bond requirements are also amended under Section 5551 of the Code. The "Craft Beverage Bond Simplification Act of 2015" amends tax payment deadlines for taxpayers with limited excise tax liability. It removes the requirement for taxpayers to furnish bonds for operations or withdrawals of distilled spirits, wines, or beer during certain periods. The "Craft Beverage Bond Simplification Act of 2015" amends tax payment deadlines for taxpayers with limited excise tax liability by removing the bond requirement for distilled spirits plants and bonded wine cellars, except as provided under section 5551(d). The "Craft Beverage Bond Simplification Act of 2015" amends tax payment deadlines by removing the bond requirement for distilled spirits plants and bonded wine cellars, with definitions provided for bonded wine cellar and bonded winery. The "Craft Beverage Bond Simplification Act of 2015" removes bond requirements for certain breweries, with an exception for taxpayers during specific periods. The amendments will take effect 90 days after the enactment of the Act.
